title: Tales From The Crypt complete 1950 series comics
description:
Tales from the Crypt (1950 E.C. Comics) comic books

cbr format.

Original and reprints complete this collection.


First issue of the series (continues from The Crypt of Terror). "The Thing From the Sea" (art by Al Feldstein), "A Fatal Caper" (art by Jack Kamen), "Rx...Death" (art by Graham Ingels), and "Impending Doom" (art by Johnny Craig). Craig cover. 
Issue #21
Tales from the Crypt (1950 E.C. Comics) 21
Tales from the Crypt (1950 E.C. Comics) #21
Published December 1950 by EC.

"A Shocking Way to Die" (art by Al Feldstein), "Terror Ride" (art by Wally Wood), "House of Horror" (art by Harvey Kurtzman), and "Death Suited Him" (art by Graham Ingels). Feldstein cover. 
Issue #22
Tales from the Crypt (1950 E.C. Comics) 22
Tales from the Crypt (1950 E.C. Comics) #22
Published February 1951 by EC.

"The Thing From the Grave" (art by Al Feldstein), "Blood Type V" (art by Graham Ingels), "Death's Turn" (art by Jack Kamen), and a Vault of Horror story, "The Curse of the Arnold Clan" (art by Johnny Craig). Feldstein cover. 
Issue #23
Tales from the Crypt (1950 E.C. Comics) 23
Tales from the Crypt (1950 E.C. Comics) #23
Published April 1951 by EC.

"Reflection of Death" (art by Al Feldstein), "Last Respects" (art by Graham Ingels), "Seance" (art by Jack Davis), and a Vault of Horror story, "Voodoo Death" (art by Johnny Craig). Feldstein cover. 
Issue #24
Tales from the Crypt (1950 E.C. Comics) 24
Tales from the Crypt (1950 E.C. Comics) #24
Published June 1951 by EC.

"Bats in My Belfry" (art by Jack Davis), "The Living Death" (art by Graham Ingels), a Vault of Horror story, "Midnight Snack" (art by Johnny Craig), and "Scared to Death" (art by Wally Wood). Feldstein cover. 
Issue #25
Tales from the Crypt (1950 E.C. Comics) 25
Tales from the Crypt (1950 E.C. Comics) #25
Published August 1951 by EC.

"The Trophy" (art by Jack Davis), "Judy, You're Not Yourself Today!" (art by Wally Wood--his final story for the title), "Loved to Death!" (art by Jack Kamen), and "The Works...in Wax!" (art by Graham Ingels). Al Feldstein cover. 
Issue #26
Tales from the Crypt (1950 E.C. Comics) 26
Tales from the Crypt (1950 E.C. Comics) #26
Published October 1951 by EC.

"Drawn and Quartered" (art by Jack Davis), a Vault of Horror story, "The Borrowed Body" (art by Howard Larsen), "Indian Burial Mound" (art by George Roussos), and "Political Pull" (art by Graham Ingels). Wally Wood cover. 
Issue #27
Tales from the Crypt (1950 E.C. Comics) 27
Tales from the Crypt (1950 E.C. Comics) #27
Published December 1951 by EC.

"Well-Cooked Hams" (art by Jack Davis), a Vault of Horror story, "Madam Bluebeard" (art by Joe Orlando--his first horror story for EC), "Return" (art by Jack Kamen), and "Horror! Head It Off" (art by Graham Ingels, who begins signing his name "Ghastly"). Wood cover. 
Issue #28
Tales from the Crypt (1950 E.C. Comics) 28
Tales from the Crypt (1950 E.C. Comics) #28
Published February 1952 by EC.

"Bargain in Death" (art by Jack Davis), a Vault of Horror story, "Ants in Her Trance" (art by Joe Orlando), "A Corny Story" (art by Jack Kamen), and "The Ventriloquist's Dummy" (art by Graham Ingels). One-page bio (with photo) of Orlando. Al Feldstein cover. 
Issue #29
Tales from the Crypt (1950 E.C. Comics) 29
Tales from the Crypt (1950 E.C. Comics) #29
Published April 1952 by EC.

"Grounds for Horror" (art by Jack Davis), a Vault of Horror story, "A Rottin' Trick" (art by Joe Orlando), "Board To Death" (art by Jack Kamen), and "A Sucker For a Spider" (art by Graham Ingels). One-page bio (with photo) of Davis, who also drew the cover. 
Issue #30
Tales from the Crypt (1950 E.C. Comics) 30
Tales from the Crypt (1950 E.C. Comics) #30
Published June 1952 by EC.

"Gas-tly Prospects" (art by Jack Davis), a Vault of Horror story, "A Hollywood Ending" (art by Joe Orlando), "Auntie, it's Coal Inside" (art by Jack Kamen), and "Mournin', Ambrose" (art by Graham Ingels). Davis cover. 
Issue #31
Tales from the Crypt (1950 E.C. Comics) 31
Tales from the Crypt (1950 E.C. Comics) #31
Published August 1952 by EC.

"Survival or Death" (art by Jack Davis), a Vault of Horror story, "The Thing in the 'Glades" (art by Al Williamson--his only story for Crypt), "Kamen's Kalamity" (art by Jack Kamen, who draws himself, Gailes, and Feldstein in the story; Graham Ingels, Johnny Craig, and Davis each draw themselves), and "Buried Treasure" (art by Ingels). Davis cover. 
Issue #32
Tales from the Crypt (1950 E.C. Comics) 32
Tales from the Crypt (1950 E.C. Comics) #32
Published October 1952 by EC.

"'Taint the Meat, It's the Humanity" (art by Jack Davis), a Vault of Horror story, "Roped In" (art by George Evans), "Cutting Cards" (art by Fred Peters), and "Squash, Anyone?" (art by Graham Ingels). Davis cover. 
Issue #33
Tales from the Crypt (1950 E.C. Comics) 33
Tales from the Crypt (1950 E.C. Comics) #33
Published December 1952 by EC.

"Lower Berth" (art by Jack Davis), a Vault of Horror story, "This Trick'll Kill You" (art by George Evans and Jack Kamen), "The Funeral" (art by Kamen), and "None But the Lonely Heart" (art by Graham Ingels). Origin of the Crypt Keeper. Davis cover. 
Issue #34
Tales from the Crypt (1950 E.C. Comics) 34
Tales from the Crypt (1950 E.C. Comics) #34
Published February 1953 by EC.

"Mirror, Mirror, On the Wall" (art by Jack Davis), a Vault of Horror story, "Oil's Well That Ends Well" (art by George Evans), "Attacks of Horror" (art by Jack Kamen), and "There Was an Old Women" (art by Graham Ingles; adapted from a Ray Bradbury story). Davis cover. 
Issue #35
Tales from the Crypt (1950 E.C. Comics) 35
Tales from the Crypt (1950 E.C. Comics) #35
Published April 1953 by EC.

"By the Fright of the Silvery Moon!" (art by Jack Davis); a Vault of Horror story, "Midnight Mess!" (art by Joe Orlando); "Busted Marriage!" (art by Jack Kamen); and "This Wraps It Up!" (art by Graham Ingels). Davis cover. 
Issue #36
Tales from the Crypt (1950 E.C. Comics) 36
Tales from the Crypt (1950 E.C. Comics) #36
Published June 1953 by EC.

"Fare Tonight, Followed by Increasing Clottyness" (art by Jack Davis), a Vault of Horror story, "Curiosity Killed" (art by George Evans), "How Green Was My Alley" (art by Jack Kamen), and "The Handler" (art by Graham Ingels; adapted from a story by Ray Bradbury). One-page bio (with photo) of George Evans. Davis cover. 
Issue #37
Tales from the Crypt (1950 E.C. Comics) 37
Tales from the Crypt (1950 E.C. Comics) #37
Published August 1953 by EC.

"Dead Right" (art by Jack Davis), a Vault of Horror story, "Pleasant Screams" (art by Joe Orlando), "Strop! You're Killing Me" (art by Bill Elder), and "The Rover Boys" (art by Graham Ingels). Davis cover. 
Issue #38
Tales from the Crypt (1950 E.C. Comics) 38
Tales from the Crypt (1950 E.C. Comics) #38
Published October 1953 by EC.

"Undertaking Palor" (art by Jack Davis), a Vault of Horror story, "The Craving Grave" (art by Joe Orlando), "The Sleeping Beauty" (art by Jack Kamen), and "Shadow of Death" (art by Graham Ingels). Davis cover. 
Issue #40
Tales from the Crypt (1950 E.C. Comics) 40
Tales from the Crypt (1950 E.C. Comics) #40
Published February 1954 by EC.

"Food For Thought" (art by Jack Davis), a Vault of Horror story, "Pearly To Dead" (art by George Evans), "Prairie Schooner" (art by Bernard Krigstein), and "Half-Baked" (art by Graham Ingels). Davis cover. 
Issue #41
Tales from the Crypt (1950 E.C. Comics) 41
Tales from the Crypt (1950 E.C. Comics) #41
Published April 1954 by EC.

"Operation Friendship" (art by Jack Davis), a Vault of Horror story, "Come Back, Little Linda" (art by George Evans), "Current Attraction" (art by Jack Kamen), and "Mess Call" (art by Graham Ingels). Davis cover. 
Issue #42
Tales from the Crypt (1950 E.C. Comics) 42
Tales from the Crypt (1950 E.C. Comics) #42
Published June 1954 by EC.

"Concerto for Violin and Werewolf" (art by Jack Davis), a Vault of Horror story, "By the Dawn's Early Light" (art by Jack Kamen), "The Bath" (art by Bernard Krigstein), and "Hoodwinked" (art by Graham Ingels). Letter to the editor from E. Nelson Bridwell. Davis cover. 
Issue #43
Tales from the Crypt (1950 E.C. Comics) 43
Tales from the Crypt (1950 E.C. Comics) #43
Published August 1954 by EC.

"Four-Way Split" (art by Jack Davis), a Vault of Horror story, "Cold War" (art by Jack Kamen), "Clots My Line" (art by George Evans), and "Accidents and Old Lace" (art by Graham Ingels). Davis cover. 
Issue #44
Tales from the Crypt (1950 E.C. Comics) 44
Tales from the Crypt (1950 E.C. Comics) #44
Published October 1954 by EC.

"Forever Ambergris" (art by Jack Davis), a Vault of Horror story, "Burial at Sea" (art by Reed Crandall), "Proposal" (art by Jack Kamen), and "The Sliceman Cometh" (art by Graham Ingels). Davis cover. 
Issue #45
Tales from the Crypt (1950 E.C. Comics) 45
Tales from the Crypt (1950 E.C. Comics) #45
Published December 1954 by EC.

"Telescope" (art by Jack Davis), "The Substitute" (art by Jack Kamen), "Murder Dream" (art by Bernard Krigstein), and "The Switch" (art by Graham "Ghastly" Ingels). One-page editorial on the Senate Subcommittee on Juvenile Delinquency investigation into the comic industry. Two-page montage of the EC office with caricatures of the artists by Marie Severin. Davis cover. 
Issue #46
Tales from the Crypt (1950 E.C. Comics) 46
Tales from the Crypt (1950 E.C. Comics) #46
Published February 1955 by EC.

Final issue of the series. "Upon Reflection" (art by Jack Davis), "Blind Alleys" (art by George Evans), "Success Story" (art by Joe Orlando), and "Tatter Up!" (art by Graham Ingels). Davis cover.
